013package org.apache.juneau.bean.openapi3;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
019
020import java.util.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.objecttools.*;
027
028/**
029 * This is the root document object for the OpenAPI specification.
030 *
031 * <p>
032 * The OpenAPI Object is the root document that describes an entire API. It contains metadata about the API,
033 * available paths and operations, parameters, responses, authentication methods, and other information.
034 *
035 * <h5 class='section'>OpenAPI Specification:</h5>
036 * <p>
037 * The OpenAPI Object is composed of the following fields:
038 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
039 *    <li><c>openapi</c> (string, REQUIRED) - The OpenAPI Specification version (e.g., "3.0.0")
040 *    <li><c>info</c> ({@link Info}, REQUIRED) - Provides metadata about the API
041 *    <li><c>servers</c> (array of {@link Server}) - An array of Server Objects providing connectivity information
042 *    <li><c>paths</c> (map of {@link PathItem}) - The available paths and operations for the API
043 *    <li><c>components</c> ({@link Components}) - An element to hold various schemas for reuse
044 *    <li><c>security</c> (array of {@link SecurityRequirement}) - Security mechanisms applied to all operations
045 *    <li><c>tags</c> (array of {@link Tag}) - A list of tags for API documentation control
046 *    <li><c>externalDocs</c> ({@link ExternalDocumentation}) - Additional external documentation
047 * </ul>
048 *
049 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
050 * <p class='bjava'>
051 *    <jc>// Create an OpenAPI document</jc>
052 *    OpenApi <jv>doc</jv> = <jk>new</jk> OpenApi()
053 *       .setOpenapi(<js>"3.0.0"</js>)
054 *       .setInfo(
055 *          <jk>new</jk> Info()
056 *             .setTitle(<js>"My API"</js>)
057 *             .setVersion(<js>"1.0.0"</js>)
058 *       )
059 *       .setPaths(
060 *          JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(
061 *             <js>"/pets"</js>, <jk>new</jk> PathItem()
062 *                .setGet(<jk>new</jk> Operation()
063 *                   .setSummary(<js>"List all pets"</js>)
064 *                )
065 *          )
066 *       );
067 * </p>
068 *
069 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
070 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.0#openapi-object">OpenAPI Specification &gt; OpenAPI Object</a>
071 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/docs/specification/basic-structure/">OpenAPI Basic Structure</a>
072 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanOpenApi3">juneau-bean-openapi-v3</a>
073 * </ul>
074 */
075public class OpenApi extends OpenApiElement {
076
077   /** Represents a null OpenAPI document */
078   public static final OpenApi NULL = new OpenApi();
079
080   private static final Comparator<String> PATH_COMPARATOR = (o1, o2) -> o1.replace('{', '@').compareTo(o2.replace('{', '@'));
081
082   private String openapi = "3.0.0";
083   private Info info;
084   private List<Server> servers;
085   private Map<String,PathItem> paths;
086   private Components components;
087   private List<SecurityRequirement> security;
088   private List<Tag> tags;
089   private ExternalDocumentation externalDocs;
090
091   /**
092    * Default constructor.
093    */
094   public OpenApi() {}
095
096   /**
097    * Copy constructor.
098    *
099    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
100    */
101   public OpenApi(OpenApi copyFrom) {
102      super(copyFrom);
103      this.openapi = copyFrom.openapi;
104      this.info = copyFrom.info;
105      this.servers = copyOf(copyFrom.servers);
106      this.paths = copyOf(copyFrom.paths);
107      this.components = copyFrom.components;
108      this.security = copyOf(copyFrom.security);
109      this.tags = copyOf(copyFrom.tags);
110      this.externalDocs = copyFrom.externalDocs;
111   }
112
113   /**
114    * Make a deep copy of this object.
115    *
116    * @return A deep copy of this object.
117    */
118   public OpenApi copy() {
119      return new OpenApi(this);
120   }
121
122   /**
123    * Returns the OpenAPI version.
124    *
125    * @return The OpenAPI version.
126    */
127   public String getOpenapi() {
128      return openapi;
129   }
130
131   /**
132    * Sets the OpenAPI version.
133    *
134    * @param value The new value for this property.
135    * @return This object.
136    */
137   public OpenApi setOpenapi(String value) {
138      this.openapi = value;
139      return this;
140   }
141
142   /**
143    * Returns the info object.
144    *
145    * @return The info object.
146    */
147   public Info getInfo() {
148      return info;
149   }
150
151   /**
152    * Sets the info object.
153    *
154    * @param value The new value for this property.
155    * @return This object.
156    */
157   public OpenApi setInfo(Info value) {
158      this.info = value;
159      return this;
160   }
161
162   /**
163    * Returns the servers list.
164    *
165    * @return The servers list.
166    */
167   public List<Server> getServers() {
168      return servers;
169   }
170
171   /**
172    * Sets the servers list.
173    *
174    * @param value The new value for this property.
175    * @return This object.
176    */
177   public OpenApi setServers(List<Server> value) {
178      this.servers = value;
179      return this;
180   }
181
182   /**
183    * Returns the paths map.
184    *
185    * @return The paths map.
186    */
187   public Map<String,PathItem> getPaths() {
188      return paths;
189   }
190
191   /**
192    * Sets the paths map.
193    *
194    * @param value The new value for this property.
195    * @return This object.
196    */
197   public OpenApi setPaths(Map<String,PathItem> value) {
198      this.paths = mapBuilder(String.class,PathItem.class).sparse().sorted(PATH_COMPARATOR).addAll(value).build();
199      return this;
200   }
201
202   /**
203    * Adds a path to this OpenAPI document.
204    *
205    * @param path The path string.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
206    * @param pathItem The path item.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
207    * @return This object.
208    */
209   public OpenApi addPath(String path, PathItem pathItem) {
210      assertArgNotNull("path", path);
211      assertArgNotNull("pathItem", pathItem);
212      if (paths == null)
213         paths = new TreeMap<>(PATH_COMPARATOR);
214      getPaths().put(path, pathItem);
215      return this;
216   }
217
218   /**
219    * Returns the components object.
220    *
221    * @return The components object.
222    */
223   public Components getComponents() {
224      return components;
225   }
226
227   /**
228    * Sets the components object.
229    *
230    * @param value The new value for this property.
231    * @return This object.
232    */
233   public OpenApi setComponents(Components value) {
234      this.components = value;
235      return this;
236   }
237
238   /**
239    * Returns the security requirements list.
240    *
241    * @return The security requirements list.
242    */
243   public List<SecurityRequirement> getSecurity() {
244      return security;
245   }
246
247   /**
248    * Sets the security requirements list.
249    *
250    * @param value The new value for this property.
251    * @return This object.
252    */
253   public OpenApi setSecurity(List<SecurityRequirement> value) {
254      this.security = value;
255      return this;
256   }
257
258   /**
259    * Returns the tags list.
260    *
261    * @return The tags list.
262    */
263   public List<Tag> getTags() {
264      return tags;
265   }
266
267   /**
268    * Sets the tags list.
269    *
270    * @param value The new value for this property.
271    * @return This object.
272    */
273   public OpenApi setTags(List<Tag> value) {
274      this.tags = value;
275      return this;
276   }
277
278   /**
279    * Bean property setter:  <property>tags</property>.
280    *
281    * <p>
282    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
283    *
284    * @param value
285    *    The new value for this property.
286    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
287    * @return This object.
288    */
289   public OpenApi setTags(Tag...value) {
290      setTags(listBuilder(Tag.class).sparse().add(value).build());
291      return this;
292   }
293
294   /**
295    * Bean property appender:  <property>tags</property>.
296    *
297    * <p>
298    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
299    *
300    * @param values
301    *    The values to add to this property.
302    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
303    * @return This object.
304    */
305   public OpenApi addTags(Tag...values) {
306      tags = listBuilder(tags).sparse().add(values).build();
307      return this;
308   }
309
310   /**
311    * Bean property appender:  <property>tags</property>.
312    *
313    * <p>
314    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
315    *
316    * @param values
317    *    The values to add to this property.
318    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
319    * @return This object.
320    */
321   public OpenApi addTags(Collection<Tag> values) {
322      tags = listBuilder(tags).sparse().addAll(values).build();
323      return this;
324   }
325
326   /**
327    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>servers</property>.
328    *
329    * <p>
330    * An array of Server Objects, which provide connectivity information to a target server.
331    *
332    * @param values
333    *    The values to add to this property.
334    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
335    * @return This object.
336    */
337   public OpenApi addServers(Server...values) {
338      servers = listBuilder(servers).sparse().add(values).build();
339      return this;
340   }
341
342   /**
343    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>servers</property>.
344    *
345    * <p>
346    * An array of Server Objects, which provide connectivity information to a target server.
347    *
348    * @param values
349    *    The values to add to this property.
350    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
351    * @return This object.
352    */
353   public OpenApi addServers(Collection<Server> values) {
354      servers = listBuilder(servers).sparse().addAll(values).build();
355      return this;
356   }
357
358   /**
359    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>security</property>.
360    *
361    * <p>
362    * A declaration of which security mechanisms can be used across the API.
363    *
364    * @param values
365    *    The values to add to this property.
366    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
367    * @return This object.
368    */
369   public OpenApi addSecurity(SecurityRequirement...values) {
370      security = listBuilder(security).sparse().add(values).build();
371      return this;
372   }
373
374   /**
375    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>security</property>.
376    *
377    * <p>
378    * A declaration of which security mechanisms can be used across the API.
379    *
380    * @param values
381    *    The values to add to this property.
382    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
383    * @return This object.
384    */
385   public OpenApi addSecurity(Collection<SecurityRequirement> values) {
386      security = listBuilder(security).sparse().addAll(values).build();
387      return this;
388   }
389
390   /**
391    * Returns the external documentation.
392    *
393    * @return The external documentation.
394    */
395   public ExternalDocumentation getExternalDocs() {
396      return externalDocs;
397   }
398
399   /**
400    * Sets the external documentation.
401    *
402    * @param value The new value for this property.
403    * @return This object.
404    */
405   public OpenApi setExternalDocs(ExternalDocumentation value) {
406      this.externalDocs = value;
407      return this;
408   }
409
410   /**
411    * Finds a reference within this OpenAPI document.
412    *
413    * @param ref The reference string (e.g., <js>"#/components/schemas/User"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk> or blank.
414    * @param c The expected class type.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
415    * @return The referenced node, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
416    */
417   public <T> T findRef(String ref, Class<T> c) {
418      assertArgNotNullOrBlank("ref", ref);
419      assertArgNotNull("c", c);
420      if (! ref.startsWith("#/"))
421         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Unsupported reference:  ''{0}''", ref);
422      try {
423         return new ObjectRest(this).get(ref.substring(1), c);
424      } catch (Exception e) {
425         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e, c, "Reference ''{0}'' could not be converted to type ''{1}''.", ref, className(c));
426      }
427   }
428
429   @Override
430   public String toString() {
431      return JsonSerializer.DEFAULT.toString(this);
432   }
433
434   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
435   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
436      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
437      return switch (property) {
438         case "openapi" -> toType(getOpenapi(), type);
439         case "info" -> toType(getInfo(), type);
440         case "servers" -> toType(getServers(), type);
441         case "paths" -> toType(getPaths(), type);
442         case "components" -> toType(getComponents(), type);
443         case "security" -> toType(getSecurity(), type);
444         case "tags" -> toType(getTags(), type);
445         case "externalDocs" -> toType(getExternalDocs(), type);
446         default -> super.get(property, type);
447      };
448   }
449
450   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
451   public OpenApi set(String property, Object value) {
452      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
453      return switch (property) {
454         case "components" -> setComponents(toType(value, Components.class));
455         case "externalDocs" -> setExternalDocs(toType(value, ExternalDocumentation.class));
456         case "info" -> setInfo(toType(value, Info.class));
457         case "openapi" -> setOpenapi(Utils.s(value));
458         case "paths" -> setPaths(mapBuilder(String.class, PathItem.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
459         case "security" -> setSecurity(listBuilder(SecurityRequirement.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
460         case "servers" -> setServers(listBuilder(Server.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
461         case "tags" -> setTags(listBuilder(Tag.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
462         default -> {
463            super.set(property, value);
464            yield this;
465         }
466      };
467   }
468
469   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
470   public Set<String> keySet() {
471      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
472         .addIf(components != null, "components")
473         .addIf(externalDocs != null, "externalDocs")
474         .addIf(info != null, "info")
475         .addIf(openapi != null, "openapi")
476         .addIf(paths != null, "paths")
477         .addIf(security != null, "security")
478         .addIf(servers != null, "servers")
479         .addIf(tags != null, "tags")
480         .build();
481      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
482   }
483
484   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
485   public OpenApi strict() {
486      super.strict();
487      return this;
488   }
489
490   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
491   public OpenApi strict(Object value) {
492      super.strict(value);
493      return this;
494   }
495
496}
